intro: Ternstroemia huberi, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Ternstroemia huberi is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
